task_summary: PR2 detects the fridge handle, aligns, grasps it, pulls to open the hinged door, verifies it is open, and retreats.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 mobile manipulator is tasked with opening a right-hinged refrigerator door. The scene shows a closed fridge near a drawer cabinet. The robot must first perceive the handle area, approach and align its end-effector, establish a secure grasp, then execute a pulling motion to swing the door open. After opening, it verifies the container state and backs away to a safe pose. Timing is moderate, precision alignment is required near the handle, and collision with surrounding furniture should be avoided.
preconditions: Robot base is positioned within reachable workspace of the fridge handle
Fridge door is closed and unlatched
Scene free of people/obstacles in swing arc
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the fridge handle.
Confirm visibility and approach to align with the handle.
Close gripper to grasp the handle and check grasp stability.
Execute door opening using a pull on the hinged door.
Verify the door is open and retreat to a safe distance.
success_criteria: Door angle increases and interior is visible
No collisions with cabinet or door
Robot retreats to a safe standoff pose
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: re-scan and adjust view
Misalignment: re-run ApproachAndAlign with tighter tolerance
Grasp slip: reopen, realign, and regrip
Door jammed: retry pull with a different approach vector
task_long_description.termination: Stop when ContainerOpen reports true and the robot has completed the retreat motion.

frame_3.now_evidence: first clear grasp on the handle is visible; contact established.
frame_3.predicts_next: pulling actuation to swing the door open should follow.

node_specs.description: Prepare the gripper for grasping the handle.
Locate the handle region on the fridge door.
Verify the handle is in view before approaching.
Move and align the end-effector with the handle.
Close gripper to grasp the handle.
Pull to swing the hinged door open.
Check that the fridge door is open.
Back off to a safe standoff pose.

recovery_strategy: Re-run detection/scan with slight base or wrist adjustment
Re-open and regrip with adjusted pose
Perform a second pull after minor re-approach
assumptions: Frames depict a right-hinged fridge door with a graspable handle; BT uses a pull strategy via hinged_door.
No explicit retries/time limits are specified by the instruction; defaults chosen from allowed bins.

expected_success_criteria: ContainerOpen becomes true and interior shelves are visible
No contact with surrounding furniture during pull and retreat
